name: TheAtlantic
text: "Much of the evangelical movement, in aligning itself with Donald Trump, has shown itself to be graceless and joyless, seized by fear, hypocritical, censorious, and filled with grievances," @Peter_Wehner writes: https://t.co/D7pCivKY6K

name: TheAtlantic
text: Earth at night is a navy-blue marble with a dusting of gold, the electric sparks of modern life. When the pandemic arrived, researchers started seeing intriguing changes in the glow, @marinakoren reports: https://t.co/ZJMMSXgmss

name: TheAtlantic
text: "I always feel like I'm never doing enough." America's public-health experts are tired, drained, and frustrated about shouting advice into a political void, @edyong209 reports. https://t.co/Mc3kt4vttF

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The independence of the Supreme Court’s conservative majority is affirmed, while still granting the president the outcome he desired," @AdamSerwer writes: https://t.co/0S9MVaITUP

name: TheAtlantic
text: Like the one-child policy, Beijing’s repressive actions against minority Uighur Muslims are about preserving power. As @meifongwriter writes, China's birth-control policies were always less about births, more about control. https://t.co/1A6oxOZS08

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Simply giving people cash turns out to be a powerful way to protect workers during a public-health crisis, to alleviate poverty, and to empower employees to bargain with employers. Uncle Sam needs to give out a lot more," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/dSLyeZzNZm

name: TheAtlantic
text:
Brazilian president Jair Bolsonaro has described the coronavirus as a “little flu,” accused the media of manufacturing “hysteria,” and railed against lockdowns, @UriLF reported in March.

On Tuesday, he tested positive for the coronavirus. https://t.co/iLMB8ktzmr

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @jameshamblin: I tried to understand when we’d reach herd immunity. It turns out the number is largely up to us. https://t.co/IAm7KirAHa

name: TheAtlantic
text: Some mathematicians believe that the threshold for herd immunity could be lower than it originally seemed. But that will depend on us, writes @jameshamblin: https://t.co/wCr5UgW48V

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @NickBaumann: Facing widespread criticism on Twitter, undergoing an internal workplace review, or having one’s book panned does not, in fact, erode one’s constitutional rights or endanger a liberal society, @ethiopienne argues. https://t.co/p1sfL2z0iC

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @jameshamblin: On how close we may be to a "herd immunity threshold" https://t.co/IAm7KirAHa

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As Americans are questioning the legitimacy of … the federal government, Roberts worked to ensure that the Supreme Court can be embraced by citizens of different perspectives as a neutral arbiter, guided by law rather than politics," @RosenJeffrey writes:https://t.co/X3dMDiZ1YX

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: Those of you read the so-called Letter should read this thoughtful rejoinder to the Letter, from @ethiopienne. And then they should stand by for rejoinders to the rejoinders.
https://t.co/lZ7JTl2Y7D

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @IsaacDovere: .@KarenBassTweets on how she might do in a debate with Pence: 

“I don’t know. I’m not sure how comfortable he is with women.”

https://t.co/nc5dAsV8uu

text: SPONSORED: The Golden State Killer eluded capture for decades. Here’s how investigators – with the help of one determined woman – brought him to justice. https://t.co/lfwxjpjfTp @HBO https://t.co/6UjY2OKckq

name: TheAtlantic
text: “Even if it’s only on Tumblr, I want her to know that she’s not getting away with it": Meet the conspiracy theorists who believe that celebrities are faking their marriages, pregnancies, and even their children's existence. https://t.co/M50ULUEXKg

name: TheAtlantic
text: “What strikes me most in your letter is the contradiction between the joy you say your lover brings you and your description of how he treats you.” @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader who is struggling to end her affair before moving away with her husband. https://t.co/s9VxN6Zl7k

name: TheAtlantic
text: Trump is "the unrivaled master at institutional corruption. And his approach to bending the Justice Department to his will will be studied as long as politicians in power fear legal accountability," @benjaminwittes writes: https://t.co/MXs8sYsiLu
